text: the director of the CIA Mike Pompeo has
made a secret visit to Pyongyang to meet
North Korean leader Kim jong-un
it's emerged the meeting took place
during the Easter weekend shortly after
mr. Pompeo was nominated by the
President and Secretary of State
America's top diplomat a short time ago
mr. Trump tweeted that the meeting went
very smoothly and a good relationship
was formed Lucinda Adams has more under
the greatest secrecy Mike Pompeo still
unconfirmed a Secretary of State
traveled to Pyongyang to meet with Kim
jong-un over the Easter weekend
president Trump currently hosting
Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe a
said talks with North Korea were under
way the u.s. hasn't had diplomatic
relations with North Korea the last time
a Secretary of State visited was in 2000
and these current talks go against
previous rhetoric between the two
leaders it's less than a year since
President Trump said North Korea's
threats of nuclear attack would we met
with fire and fury like the world had
never seen and in an ongoing spat kim
jeong-hoon accused the president of
mentally deranged behavior but South
Korea's hosting of the Winter Olympics
in February gave an unexpected window
for diplomacy on a North Korean charm
offensive the leader sister kim yo-jong
hand delivered an invitation to the
South Korean president to visit
Pyongyang u.s. vice president Mike Pence
refused to greet the North Koreans and
push for tougher sanctions but last
month President Trump
stunned the international community
accepting Pyongyang's invitation for
direct talks an unprecedented meeting of
the two state leaders time to prepare
for the summit plan for early June is
tight five sites are being considered
which are likely to be on neutral ground
but first president Trump has the
challenge of getting Mike Pompeo
confirmed a Secretary of State later
this week which with such a slim Senate
Majority is far from certain
lucinda adam BBC
